00055 #if (KRB5_VERSION > 131)
00056 /* XXX argggg, there's gotta be a better way than just duplicating this
00057  * whole struct.  Unfortunately, this is in a "private" header file,
00058  * so this is our best choice at this point :-/
00059  */
00060 
00061 typedef struct _krb5_gss_ctx_id_rec {
00062    unsigned int initiate : 1;   /* nonzero if initiating, zero if accepting */
00063    unsigned int established : 1;
00064    unsigned int big_endian : 1;
00065    unsigned int have_acceptor_subkey : 1;
00066    unsigned int seed_init : 1;  /* XXX tested but never actually set */
00067 #ifdef CFX_EXERCISE
00068    unsigned int testing_unknown_tokid : 1; /* for testing only */
00069 #endif
00070    OM_uint32 gss_flags;
00071    unsigned char seed[16];
00072    krb5_principal here;
00073    krb5_principal there;
00074    krb5_keyblock *subkey;
00075    int signalg;
00076    size_t cksum_size;
00077    int sealalg;
00078    krb5_keyblock *enc;
00079    krb5_keyblock *seq;
00080    krb5_timestamp endtime;
00081    krb5_flags krb_flags;
00082    /* XXX these used to be signed.  the old spec is inspecific, and
00083       the new spec specifies unsigned.  I don't believe that the change
00084       affects the wire encoding. */
00085    uint64_t seq_send;           /* gssint_uint64 */
00086    uint64_t seq_recv;           /* gssint_uint64 */
00087    void *seqstate;
00088    krb5_auth_context auth_context;
00089    gss_OID_desc *mech_used;     /* gss_OID_desc */
00090     /* Protocol spec revision
00091        0 => RFC 1964 with 3DES and RC4 enhancements
00092        1 => draft-ietf-krb-wg-gssapi-cfx-01
00093        No others defined so far.  */
00094    int proto;
00095    krb5_cksumtype cksumtype;    /* for "main" subkey */
00096    krb5_keyblock *acceptor_subkey; /* CFX only */
00097    krb5_cksumtype acceptor_subkey_cksumtype;
00098 #ifdef CFX_EXERCISE
00099     gss_buffer_desc init_token;
00100 #endif
00101 } krb5_gss_ctx_id_rec, *krb5_gss_ctx_id_t;
00102 
00103 #else   /* KRB5_VERSION > 131 */
00104 
00105 typedef struct _krb5_gss_ctx_id_rec {
00106         int initiate;
00107         u_int32_t gss_flags;
00108         int seed_init;
00109         unsigned char seed[16];
00110         krb5_principal here;
00111         krb5_principal there;
00112         krb5_keyblock *subkey;
00113         int signalg;
00114         int cksum_size;
00115         int sealalg;
00116         krb5_keyblock *enc;
00117         krb5_keyblock *seq;
00118         krb5_timestamp endtime;
00119         krb5_flags krb_flags;
00120         krb5_ui_4 seq_send;
00121         krb5_ui_4 seq_recv;
00122         void *seqstate;
00123         int established;
00124         int big_endian;
00125         krb5_auth_context auth_context;
00126         gss_OID_desc *mech_used;
00127         int nctypes;
00128         krb5_cksumtype *ctypes;
00129 } krb5_gss_ctx_id_rec, *krb5_gss_ctx_id_t;
00130 
00131 #endif /* KRB5_VERSION */
00132 
00133 
00134 static int
00135 write_keyblock(char **p, char *end, struct _krb5_keyblock *arg)
00136 {
00137         gss_buffer_desc tmp;
00138 
00139         if (WRITE_BYTES(p, end, arg->enctype)) return -1;
00140         tmp.length = arg->length;
00141         tmp.value = arg->contents;
00142         if (write_buffer(p, end, &tmp)) return -1;
00143         return 0;
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*
00147  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00148  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00149  *
00150  * We shouldn't be using these definitions
00151  *
00152  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00153  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00154  */
00155 /* for 3DES */
00156 #define KG_USAGE_SEAL 22
00157 #define KG_USAGE_SIGN 23
00158 #define KG_USAGE_SEQ  24
00159 
00160 /* for rfc???? */
00161 #define KG_USAGE_ACCEPTOR_SEAL  22
00162 #define KG_USAGE_ACCEPTOR_SIGN  23
00163 #define KG_USAGE_INITIATOR_SEAL 24
00164 #define KG_USAGE_INITIATOR_SIGN 25
00165 
00166 /* Lifted from mit src/lib/gssapi/krb5/gssapiP_krb5.h */
00167 enum seal_alg {
00168   SEAL_ALG_NONE            = 0xffff,
00169   SEAL_ALG_DES             = 0x0000,
00170   SEAL_ALG_1               = 0x0001, /* not published */
00171   SEAL_ALG_MICROSOFT_RC4   = 0x0010, /* microsoft w2k;  */
00172   SEAL_ALG_DES3KD          = 0x0002
00173 };
00174 
00175 #define KEY_USAGE_SEED_ENCRYPTION       0xAA
00176 #define KEY_USAGE_SEED_INTEGRITY        0x55
00177 #define KEY_USAGE_SEED_CHECKSUM         0x99
00178 #define K5CLENGTH 5
00179 
00180 extern void krb5_enc_des3;
00181 extern void krb5int_enc_des3;
00182 extern void krb5int_enc_arcfour;
00183 extern void krb5int_enc_aes128;
00184 extern void krb5int_enc_aes256;
00185 extern int krb5_derive_key();
00186 
00187 /*
00188  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00189  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00190  *
00191  * We should be passing down a single key to the kernel
00192  * and it should be deriving the other keys.  We cannot
00193  * depend on any of this stuff being accessible in the
00194  * future.
00195  *
00196  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00197  * XXX Hack alert! XXX Do NOT submit upstream!
00198  */
00199 /*
00200  * Function to derive a new key from a given key and given constant data.
00201  */
00202 static krb5_error_code
00203 derive_key(const krb5_keyblock *in, krb5_keyblock *out, int usage, char extra)
00204 {
00205         krb5_error_code code;
00206         unsigned char constant_data[K5CLENGTH];
00207         krb5_data datain;
00208         int keylength;
00209         void *enc;
00210 
00211         switch (in->enctype) {
00212 #ifdef ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_RAW
00213         case ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_RAW:
00214                 keylength = 24;
00215 /* Extra hack, the structure was renamed as rc4 was added... */
00216 #if defined(ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC)
00217                 enc = &krb5int_enc_des3;
00218 #else
00219                 enc = &krb5_enc_des3;
00220 #endif
00221                 break;
00222 #endif
00223 #ifdef ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC
00224         case ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC:
00225                 keylength = 16;
00226                 enc = &krb5int_enc_arcfour;
00227                 break;
00228 #endif
00229         default:
00230                 code = KRB5_BAD_ENCTYPE;
00231                 goto out;
00232         }
00233 
00234         /* allocate memory for output key */
00235         if ((out->contents = malloc(keylength)) == NULL) {
00236                 code = ENOMEM;
00237                 goto out;
00238         }
00239         out->length = keylength;
00240         out->enctype = in->enctype;
00241 
00242         datain.data = (char *) constant_data;
00243         datain.length = K5CLENGTH;
00244 
00245         datain.data[0] = (usage>>24)&0xff;
00246         datain.data[1] = (usage>>16)&0xff;
00247         datain.data[2] = (usage>>8)&0xff;
00248         datain.data[3] = usage&0xff;
00249 
00250         datain.data[4] = (char) extra;
00251 
00252         if ((code = krb5_derive_key(enc, in, out, &datain))) {
00253                 free(out->contents);
00254                 out->contents = NULL;
00255         }
00256 
00257   out:
00258         if (code)
00259                 printerr(0, "ERROR: derive_key returning error %d (%s)\n",
00260                          code, error_message(code));
00261         return (code);
00262 }
00263 
00264 /*
00265  * We really shouldn't know about glue-layer context structure, but
00266  * we need to get at the real krb5 context pointer.  This should be
00267  * removed as soon as we say there is no support for MIT Kerberos
00268  * prior to 1.4 -- which gives us "legal" access to the context info.
00269  */
00270 typedef struct gss_union_ctx_id_t {
00271         gss_OID         mech_type;
00272         gss_ctx_id_t    internal_ctx_id;
00273 } gss_union_ctx_id_desc, *gss_union_ctx_id_t;
00274 
00275 int
00276 serialize_krb5_ctx(gss_ctx_id_t ctx, gss_buffer_desc *buf)
00277 {
00278         krb5_gss_ctx_id_t kctx = ((gss_union_ctx_id_t)ctx)->internal_ctx_id;
00279         char *p, *end;
00280         static int constant_zero = 0;
00281         static int constant_one = 1;
00282         static int constant_two = 2;
00283         uint32_t word_seq_send;
00284         u_int64_t seq_send_64bit;
00285         uint32_t v2_flags = 0;
00286         krb5_keyblock derived_key;
00287         uint32_t numkeys;
00288 
00289         if (!(buf->value = calloc(1, MAX_CTX_LEN)))
00290                 goto out_err;
00291         p = buf->value;
00292         end = buf->value + MAX_CTX_LEN;
00293 
00294         switch (kctx->sealalg) {
00295         case SEAL_ALG_DES:
00296                 /* Old format of context to the kernel */
00297                 if (kctx->initiate) {
00298                         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_one)) goto out_err;
00299                 }
00300                 else {
00301                         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_zero)) goto out_err;
00302                 }
00303                 if (kctx->seed_init) {
00304                         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_one)) goto out_err;
00305                 }
00306                 else {
00307                         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_zero)) goto out_err;
00308                 }
00309                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, &kctx->seed, sizeof(kctx->seed)))
00310                         goto out_err;
00311                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, kctx->signalg)) goto out_err;
00312                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, kctx->sealalg)) goto out_err;
00313                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, kctx->endtime)) goto out_err;
00314                 word_seq_send = kctx->seq_send;
00315                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, word_seq_send)) goto out_err;
00316                 if (write_oid(&p, end, kctx->mech_used)) goto out_err;
00317 
00318                 printerr(2, "serialize_krb5_ctx: serializing keys with "
00319                          "enctype %d and length %d\n",
00320                          kctx->enc->enctype, kctx->enc->length);
00321 
00322                 if (write_keyblock(&p, end, kctx->enc)) goto out_err;
00323                 if (write_keyblock(&p, end, kctx->seq)) goto out_err;
00324                 break;
00325         case SEAL_ALG_MICROSOFT_RC4:
00326         case SEAL_ALG_DES3KD:
00327                 /* New format of context to the kernel */
00328                 /* s32 endtime;
00329                  * u32 flags;
00330                  * #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR        0x00000001
00331                  * #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX              0x00000002
00332                  * #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY  0x00000004
00333                  * u64 seq_send;
00334                  * u32  enctype;
00335                  * u32  size_of_each_key;    (  size in bytes )
00336                  * u32  number_of_keys;      (  N (assumed to be 3 for now) )
00337                  * keydata-1;                (  Ke  (Kenc for DES3) )
00338                  * keydata-2;                (  Ki  (Kseq for DES3) )
00339                  * keydata-3;                (  Kc (derived checksum key) )
00340                  */
00341                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_two)) goto out_err;
00342                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, kctx->endtime)) goto out_err;
00343 
00344                 /* Only applicable flag for this is initiator */
00345                 if (kctx->initiate) v2_flags |= KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR;
00346                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, v2_flags)) goto out_err;
00347 
00348                 seq_send_64bit = kctx->seq_send;
00349                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, seq_send_64bit)) goto out_err;
00350 
00351                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, kctx->enc->enctype)) goto out_err;
00352                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, kctx->enc->length)) goto out_err;
00353                 numkeys = 3;
00354                 if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, numkeys)) goto out_err;
00355                 printerr(2, "serialize_krb5_ctx: serializing %d keys with "
00356                          "enctype %d and size %d\n",
00357                          numkeys, kctx->enc->enctype, kctx->enc->length);
00358 
00359                 /* Ke */
00360                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, kctx->enc->contents,
00361                                 kctx->enc->length))
00362                         goto out_err;
00363 
00364                 /* Ki */
00365                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, kctx->enc->contents,
00366                                 kctx->enc->length))
00367                         goto out_err;
00368 
00369                 /* Kc */
00370                 if (derive_key(kctx->seq, &derived_key,
00371                                KG_USAGE_SIGN, KEY_USAGE_SEED_CHECKSUM))
00372                         goto out_err;
00373                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, derived_key.contents,
00374                                 derived_key.length))
00375                         goto out_err;
00376                 free(derived_key.contents);
00377                 break;
00378         default:
00379                 printerr(0, "ERROR: serialize_krb5_ctx: unsupported seal "
00380                          "algorithm %d\n", kctx->sealalg);
00381                 goto out_err;
00382         }
00383 
00384         buf->length = p - (char *)buf->value;
00385         return 0;
00386 
00387 out_err:
00388         printerr(0, "ERROR: failed serializing krb5 context for kernel\n");
00389         if (buf->value) {
00390                 free(buf->value);
00391         }
00392         buf->value = NULL;
00393         buf->length = 0;
00394         return -1;
00395 }
00396

00398 #endif /* HAVE_LUCID_CONTEXT_SUPPORT */
